result.execSummary:
The defendant Jose A Garcia was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Court costs are waived. Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law and must pay mandatory DNA surcharge.
Alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations. No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.

Drug assessment and follow through with recommendations. No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.

Do not drive unless properly licensed. Voting prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored. Firearm warning given. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jose A Garcia

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Def does not plan to seek postconviction relief.

Defendant Jose A Garcia in court with attorney Gretchen Grace Rosenke.  Antoinette L Rich appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Darlene Shue.  If def. pleas to the charge the State will recommend 120 days RCJ.  Defendant requests probation.  
Plea form is filed.  Judge conducts plea colloquey.  Defendant pleas NC and is found G by the court.  Defendant to go to ZCI from court.

called radio room on 1/21/16 at 1:50 pm - cancelled warrant with #6411

Defendant Jose A Garcia in court with attorney Erin Larsen for attorney Gretchen G. Rosenke.  Dirk Christian Jensen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Darlene Shue
BTC: Defendant to post an additional $200 by 5pm today or Report to Racine County Jail. Report to ZCI after court.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
Warrant forwarded to RCSO for entry.

Attorney Gretchen G. Rosenke appeared by speaker phone. Antoinette L. Rich appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Darlene Shue
Def- Request the bench warrant be stayed for 48 hours to try to get in contact with the defendant.
BTC: Bench warrant issued - stay for 48 hours.
